title: 香港金總就極權無理打壓抗爭支援之譴責聲明

replies.msg:
警方今日（12月19日）高調召開記者招待會，會上將「星火同盟」與洗黑錢活動扯上關係。然而有關指控並未有充分實質證據，有混淆視聽和誤導公眾之嫌。星火同盟素以為抗爭者提供人道援助聞名，警方此舉令人質疑其用意為凍結異見人士資產，進一步破壞香港自由經濟聲譽。香港金融業職工總會就此事件予以強烈譴責。

混淆視聽、誤導市民

警方於記者會以大量本地現金存入為由作為懷疑「星火同盟」洗黑錢的理據。然而，星火乃目前香港其中一個大型籌款平台，每日擁有大量現金流動並非不尋常。根據目前洗黑錢法律定義（見附註），警方並未提供具體證據證明「星火同盟」與洗黑錢活動有任何關連。警方在欠缺充足調查下高調將眾籌平台作人道支援用途誤導成洗黑錢活動，有意圖令「星火同盟」冠以不法組織之名的嫌疑。

散播白色恐怖

「星火同盟」作為反送中活動的抗爭者作人道支援的眾籌平台，社會上數以萬計的市民及機構也是其捐贈者。警方的高調行徑，似意圖令市民因懼怕被冠上「洗黑錢」莫須有罪名而停止支援抗爭者。

肆意凍結異見人士資產

香港作為自由經濟之都，享有國際金融中心美譽，絕對不能容許在沒有充足理據下肆意凍結異見人士資產。一旦有此先例，任何懷疑與當權者對立或有異見人士或組織，都有着可能被冠上「洗黑錢」或其他罪名而面臨資產被凍結，甚至負上個人刑責。此舉使人身及財產安全失去真正保障，足令外商擔心自身投資不受法律保障，嚴重打擊其對香港經濟自由度的信心，國際金融中心的地位受到重大威脅。

［附註：洗黑錢之法律定義：

洗黑錢是指將透過犯罪或其他非法手段所獲得的資產偽裝為合法的收入。

過程大致可分為以下三個階段:
1. 存放（處置）：將犯罪得益放進金融體系內。
2. 掩藏（離析、多層化、分層化）：將犯罪得益轉換成另一種形式，並創造多層複雜的金融交易來隱藏資金的勾核線索。例如從現金換成支票、貴重金屬、股票、保險儲蓄、物業等。
3. 整合（融合）：經過不同的掩飾後，將清洗後的財產如合法財產般融入經濟體系。］

HKFU’s Denunciation of Unreasonable Suppression on Supporting Protesters

Hong Kong Police, without any valid and solid evidence, drew far-fetched inferences by saying Spark Alliance involved in money laundering activities in the press conference convened on 19 December. The allegation tended to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods. Spark Alliance is renowned for their humanitarian aid offered to protesters. Hong Kong Police was questioned for their intention to freeze assets of dissidents, leading to the ruin the reputation of Hong Kong economy. Hong Kong Financial Industry Employees General Union hereby strongly condemns the act taken by Hong Kong Police Force.

Misleading and deceitful message to the public

In the press conference, Hong Kong Police claimed that Spark Alliance was suspicious for money laundering due to substantial amount of cash transferred to the concerned account. However, considering Spark Alliance is one of the large-scaled crowdfunding platforms in Hong Kong, it is common to maintain a significant amount of cash flow. Pursuant to the existing definition of money laundering in law (see notes), no evidence was provided by Hong Kong Police to prove the engagement in money laundering by Spark Alliance. Hong Kong Police was in lack of comprehensive and sufficient investigation but misinformed the general public that the crowdfunding platform targeted to conduct money laundering but in fact for humanitarian aid. They attempted to hat Spark Alliance unlawful organisation.

Spread of White Terror

Spark Alliance is a crowdfunding platform to offer humanitarian aid for protestors involved in Anti-Extradition Law Amendment Bill Movement all the time. Numerous members in the society and organisations gave their donation to Spark Alliance. The high-profile act of Hong Kong Police tends to suspend the public from supporting protesters because of the fear to be charged money laundering unreasonably.

Indiscriminate freeze of dissidents’ assets

As an international financial hub, Hong Kong is recognised for her freedom in economy and robust legal system with no tolerance on indiscriminate freeze of dissidents’ assets. If any precedent is set, individuals or organisations against the regime are likely to be charged money laundering and their assets will be frozen, or they will even be criminally liable. As a result, the confidence of foreign investors in freedom of Hong Kong economy may be badly shaken if they find that their safety, investment and assets are not comprehensively protected under the law, result in severe threat on our status of international financial hub.

[Note
The definition of money laundering in law:

Money laundering is the processing of these criminal proceeds to disguise their illegal origin.

The process involves the following three stages:

1. Placement – The physical disposal of cash or other assets derived from criminal activity

2. Layering – The separation of illicit proceeds from their source by layers of financial transactions intended to conceal the origin of the proceeds, for example, converting cash into cheque, precious metal, shares, savings insurance plan and property etc.

3. Integration – Supplying apparent legitimacy to illicit wealth through the re-entry of the funds into the economy in what appears to be normal business or personal transactions ]
